solution_line_template: There are {days_per_week} days in a week and they're going for {num_weeks} weeks so that's {days_per_week}*{num_weeks} = <<{days_per_week}*{num_weeks}={total_days}>>{total_days} days
The daily rate is ${daily_rate} and they are staying for {total_days} days so that's {daily_rate}*{total_days} = $<<{daily_rate}*{total_days}={rental_fee}>>{rental_fee}
There is also a ${pet_fee} pet fee on top of their rental fee of ${rental_fee} so that's {pet_fee}+{rental_fee} = $<<{pet_fee}+{rental_fee}={total_before_service}>>{total_before_service}
There is a 20% fee on the ${total_before_service} so the fee comes to {service_fee_percent_decimal}*{total_before_service} = $370.00

The rental will costs ${total_before_service} and there is ${service_fee} service/cleaning fee for a total of {total_before_service}+{service_fee} = $<<{total_before_service}+{service_fee}={total_bill}>>{total_bill}

They need to pay {security_deposit_percent_num}% of the entire bill as a security deposit so that will be .5*{total_bill} = $<<{security_deposit_percent_num}*{percent_factor}*{total_bill}={security_deposit}>>{security_deposit}
